reviewText: Awesome movie, great story!!! Really well done.
This is an inspiring true story written and directed by the producer of Faith Like Potatoes.

This movie was fantastic! Truly had me in tears, perfectly made. I was in tears, mainly tears of joy seeing God's love and strength through the whole movie. Never give up, always pray and trust in the Lord your God, He will never let you down. Praise be to God.
Great inspirational movie for the whole family!
good movie

It was a very inspiring movie. Reminds me that I have nothing in my life to complain about. And a good reminder that just because I don't see God, it doesn't mean He's not there. God loves us so much that He gave His one and only Son for us.
Wholesome and family friendly. A story of compassion, friendship and most of all Godly!
Slow moving but great story!
good movie, pleasant surprise
Yes, it was a bit slow but the power of God to heal a heart and a family is very powerful. Can you forgive? Yes, you can BUT only with God's help.
Content  excellent

While I LOVED the movie Faith Like Potatoes (same producers directed it) ...this movie left me lacking.

Faith Like Potatoes was superb.

This movie just fell flat for me.

I wasn't invested in the characters....their story wasn't developed fully to really draw me in.

For lack of a better description....the story line was just disjointed in so many places. It'd skip forward a few years and you're left wondering how they got from here to there.... what transpired in their life in that time frame etc etc.

The back story was touched upon here and there but wasn't really delved into to give you a real good feel for the characters in regards to what makes them tick...how they feel about things.

It was disappointing.
Excellent family movie

Enjoyed this movie.

Lame, I mean really lame. I turned it off after 20 mins.

This is an inspiring movie of a young orphan who has to develop persistence to overcome a string of hardship in his life. It takes place in South Africa and shows the kindness of people especially that of the native people of South Africa who love this white boy and care for him when he is abandoned. Later he returns the care in helping others. It has a Christian focus but is not heavy handed in it's message.

Faith Like Potatoes is my wife's very favorite movie.  We looked forward to another by the same folks.  While it hasn't replaced Faith Like Potatoes on the top of the list, we still very much enjoyed it and have watched it twice already.  After you've seen it the first time, you'll notice some cameo's of the real people in the film too.
Poignant movie!
I love that it was faith based and the acting was very good but it was very slow and at times disjointed.

Born To Win was a very touching film.  Highly inspirational, something to remind you that God is still in control and working all things for our good.  It is definitely too intense for young children, but worth watching for the adults.
Great movie and Testimony of the Lord's Grace and Mercy!

I was very disappointed in this movie. It was nothing like their other movie *Faith like potatoes* I wouldn't waste my money to purchase this movie, I'd wait and watch it for free. I wasted $14.99 & don't have money to waste! :-(

Powerfully intense, realistic, and moving. Against impossible odds, a man deals with pain at many levels and is faced with the reality of what true faith is and isn't through relationship flaws, circumstances beyond all control, and hidden anger from life's hard knocks.
I am ready to see it again....God is ALIVE!!
Great movie

Awesome. Very touching.  Motivating. Absolutely enjoyed it. Highly recommend.

Absolutely loved this movie!  My wife and I watched it together and we had a hard time holding back tears. Makes me want to get back in church and change my life back towards God again. Thank you for sharing this true story!
Needed to hear the message in this movie! Awesome!
Loved this movie. Very beautiful scenery, and a Gospel-oriented plot. Love how God works in redeeming His people and in preserving marriage covenants.
Fantastic story that ends with a bang!

My daughter had a stroke. Our son passed away, yet we saw God go with us.  Yes. We had great pain but we also felt God's care for us.  So it made this move really hit home.  Faith is standing when it does not make sense.
Thumbs up

I didn't really love what happened in the movie (physical abuse & abandonment of a child), but loved the authenticity & overwhelming display of God's love & faithfulness.

This is probably the best Christian based movie I've seen. I rented it on Amazon, but ordered the DVD the following day. Great inspirational movie!

True story. Courageous and inspiring.
